channel.title: Double XP Weekends
channel.description: Hi im wanting to make double xp weekends so like on friday it starts the command and i dont need to put it in and on sunday at midnight it turns off is there a way to do that or do i have to just put it in myself every weekend?

item.title: Double XP Weekends
item.dc:creator: @escalation escalation
item.description:
@escalation wrote:

EDIT:My bad, I added it in wrong. It works.

Read full topic

item.title: Double XP Weekends
item.dc:creator: @Clawz_fury lare69
item.description:
@Clawz_fury wrote:

Why are you telling him to use a boolean? To be honest I don’t think he wants to update his server every time there is a double exp day.

Just use the Calender/Gregorian Calender Classes so it automatically sets on that day

They are located in the utility package I believe; If you need further help you may pm me or something.

Read full topic

item.title: Double XP Weekends
item.dc:creator: @Sun_Chips Sun Chips
item.description:
@Sun_Chips wrote:

I dont no the exact variables your server uses but it would be

if (playerCommand.equalsIgnoreCase("startdouble") && playerRights >= 3) { Config.doubleExperience = true; } if (playerCommand.equalsIgnoreCase("enddouble") && playerRights >= 3) { Config.doubleExperience = false; }

its that simple.

Read full topic

item.title: Double XP Weekends
item.dc:creator: @DannyBoy1995 DannyBoy1995
item.description:
@DannyBoy1995 wrote:

[quote=“Sun Chips, post:39, topic:391409”]either move “doubleExperience” to the top of your commands.java or change your two commands to this

if (playerCommand.equalsIgnoreCase("startdouble")) { Config.doubleExperience = true; } if (playerCommand.equalsIgnoreCase("enddouble")) { Config.doubleExperience = false; }

and that should be it.[/quote]
and now if i wanted these to be owner commands how would i do that cause i dont want regular players doing it lol

Read full topic

item.title: Double XP Weekends
item.dc:creator: @Sun_Chips Sun Chips
item.description:
@Sun_Chips wrote:

either move “doubleExperience” to the top of your commands.java or change your two commands to this

if (playerCommand.equalsIgnoreCase("startdouble")) { Config.doubleExperience = true; } if (playerCommand.equalsIgnoreCase("enddouble")) { Config.doubleExperience = false; }

and that should be it.

item.title: Double XP Weekends
item.dc:creator: @DannyBoy1995 DannyBoy1995
item.description:
@DannyBoy1995 wrote:

Sun Chips:

first of all don’t make it final since its going to be changing, secondly, post the 2 commands that you put in your config.java.

and i didnt put any commands in my config.java they were in my commands.java heres the commands

if (playerCommand.equalsIgnoreCase(“startdouble”)) {
doubleExperience = true;
}
if (playerCommand.equalsIgnoreCase(“enddouble”)) {
doubleExperience = false;
}

item.description:
@DannyBoy1995 wrote:

[quote=“Sun Chips, post:35, topic:391409”]you added it, so at the top of the file where you put

that “doubleExperience” variable is not the same as the “doubleExperience” used in the commands. if you still don’t understand then copy and paste the code you actually put into your files and ill fix it for you.[/quote]
This is what i declared in my config.java
public static final boolean doubleExperience = false;

item.title: Double XP Weekends
item.dc:creator: @DannyBoy1995 DannyBoy1995
item.description:
@DannyBoy1995 wrote:

[quote=“Sun Chips, post:33, topic:391409”][quote author=durial12 link=topic=487357.msg3572246#msg3572246 date=1303145196]
If it’s static then how will he change it?
[/quote]

Im thinking your confusing final and static.

@latest problems: your getting this

src\server\model\players\packets\Commands.java:74: cannot find symbol symbol : variable doubleExperience location: class server.model.players.packets.Commands doubleExperience = true; ^ src\server\model\players\packets\Commands.java:77: cannot find symbol symbol : variable doubleExperience location: class server.model.players.packets.Commands doubleExperience = false;

because the boolean you declared and the boolean your using isnt the same its most likely you dropped a capitalization, just double check and remember Java is case sensitive.[/quote]
where would i go about finding that?

Read full topic

item.title: Double XP Weekends
item.dc:creator: @Sun_Chips Sun Chips
item.description:
@Sun_Chips wrote:

durial12:

If it’s static then how will he change it?

Im thinking your confusing final and static.

@latest problems: your getting this

src\server\model\players\packets\Commands.java:74: cannot find symbol symbol : variable doubleExperience location: class server.model.players.packets.Commands doubleExperience = true; ^ src\server\model\players\packets\Commands.java:77: cannot find symbol symbol : variable doubleExperience location: class server.model.players.packets.Commands doubleExperience = false;

because the boolean you declared and the boolean your using isnt the same its most likely you dropped a capitalization, just double check and remember Java is case sensitive.

Read full topic

item.title: Double XP Weekends
item.dc:creator: @durial12 durial12
item.description:
@durial12 wrote:

if (isFriday = true) {

sM(“IT’S " + day +”, " + day +", EVERYBODY LOVES" + day +);
weSoExcited = true;
whichSeat();
}

Read full topic

item.title: Double XP Weekends
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

[quote=“Loveandpower, post:30, topic:391409”][quote author=durial12 link=topic=487357.msg3572413#msg3572413 date=1303156230]
That would only work if first of all the server started exactly on monday morning. Then you’d need another timer to turn it off again, and all of this would be in process() so it would be waay out of time.
[/quote]Not to mention laggy, adding stuff to process = a no no[/quote]

Only if your timer system is shit. All you have to do is have a static Calendar instance, check if the day is FRIDAY, if it is, set to boolean to true, and you can either check if it’s SUNDAY and then make it false, or just see if the ms amount has passed.

Read full topic
